SPOTLIGHT MBO Partners is pleased to announce the appointment of 7 independent professionals <http://www.mbopartners.com/news-events/mbo-partners-appoints-first-independent-consultant-advisory-board> who will together form a new Independent Consulting Executive Board (ICEB). Serving in an advisory capacity, the ICEB’s mission is to provide objective advice and counsel on what is necessary to create an environment that delivers exceptional value to independent consultants and their clients. These valuable insights will enable MBO Partners to fine-tune its strategic initiatives, service offerings and market awareness. Learn more about the members of the ICEB <http://www.mboco.com/we-are-mbo/advisoryboard>.
-Marcelle Saab
Program Manager, MBO Partners

5 WAYS TO USE SOCIAL MEDIA TO PROMOTE YOUR INDEPENDENT CONSULTING BUSINESS Companies of all sizes are utilizing social media marketing. From Facebook and Google+ accounts to Twitter handles and LinkedIn <http://www.linkedin.com/company/mbo-partners/products?trk=tabs_biz_product> pages, businesses have learned that social media can produce big results. The good news about this medium is that it doesn’t necessarily require the marketing budget of a large corporation to promote your business. Here are five ways that an independent consultant can promote their practice effectively with social media:
1. Establish Yourself as an Expert
No matter your field, social media is an excellent opportunity to establish your business as a source of expertise. Independent consultants might use Facebook to share breaking industry news, give how-to tips, or opine on hot topics related to their field. Twitter can be used to share helpful articles, or to link back to an informational post on your company blog <http://www.mbopartners.com/blog/what-your-blog-says-about-you-tips-blogging-your-way-expert-status-2>. Independent consultants offering professional services may choose to contribute their knowledge on LinkedIn Answers <http://www.linkedin.com/answers>, a forum for professionals to answer questions related to their field of expertise.
